page.title: 01Llanwyddelan and Llanlugan
page.content: This is a rural area containing one inn (much modernised with frequent discos and catering for caravan and pony trekking holidaymakers. The churches and chapels are not as well attended. The principal almost the sole industry is sheep farming. Since the introduction of EEC grants the land has become over exploited with a subsequent increase in meat overproduction and an corresponding decrease in moorland wildlife habitat (corlews are becomng more rare) as a result of intensive farming sheep and cattle disease seems to be increasing while the time the farmer has to walk around his land becomes less. Also local authorities seem less able to help aspiring young farmers to gain a foothold. Something is desperately wrong!
